description: U.S. President Donald Trump has pledged to treat any armed attack on Qatar as a threat to the United States' own security, according to a document published on Wednesday that says U.S. forces could step in to defend the Middle Eastern nation.
title: Trump signs order pledging to defend Qatar against any armed attack

description: A three-month investigation into more than two dozen allegations against the president of First Nations University of Canada, commissioned by the institution’s board in 2023, concluded with a stark assessment of her conduct.
title: First Nations University president fired key whistleblower behind scathing review of her conduct

description: A 26-year-old man will serve 4½ years in jail after being found guilty of his involvement in an arson and shooting at the Vancouver Island home of Punjabi musician AP Dhillon. RCMP have an arrest warrant out for a second suspect, who is still at large.
title: Man sentenced for arson, shooting at B.C. home of Punjabi musician AP Dhillon

description: Minnesota Lynx's five-times All-Star Napheesa Collier ripped into the WNBA's leadership and Commissioner Cathy Engelbert in a post-season media conference on Tuesday, accusing the league of a "tone-deaf, dismissive" approach to players.
title: 'Worst leadership in the world,' says WNBA player in drama overshadowing finals

description: The Canadian government is warning citizens who list "X" as their gender on their passports could have problems entering the U.S.
title: Canada issues warning for citizens with gender-neutral passports travelling to U.S.

description: Israel's defence minister on Wednesday ordered all remaining Palestinians to leave Gaza City, saying it was their "last opportunity" and that anyone who stayed would be considered a militant supporter and face the "full force" of Israel's latest offensive.
title: Israeli defence minister says Palestinians who stay in Gaza City will be considered militants

description: U.S. President Donald Trump was reminded Wednesday that FIFA, not any government, ultimately decides which cities will host 2026 World Cup games.
title: Canadian FIFA VP pushes back on Trump comments about moving World Cup games from 'dangerous' cities

description: Chunk, a towering brown bear with a broken jaw, swept the competition Tuesday in the popular Fat Bear Week contest — his first win after narrowly finishing in second place three previous years.
title: Chunk, a 1,200-pound bear with a broken jaw, wins Alaska's popular Fat Bear Week contest

description: Jane Goodall, the British conservationist and researcher renowned for her work with chimpanzees, has died at age 91.
title: Jane Goodall, conservationist and chimpanzee researcher, dead at 91

description: Cookie lovers be warned, a new online scam is overcharging and under-delivering for a popular treat. As Yasmine Ghania reports, fraudsters have been posing as Girl Guides cookie sellers on community forums and tricking people into paying for the non-existent sweets.
title: B.C. Girl Guides warn of online cookie scam

description: Scientists have uncovered new types of organics in icy geysers spouting from Saturn's moon Enceladus, bolstering the likelihood that the ocean world may harbour conditions suitable for life.
title: Discovery on Saturn's moon Enceladus boosts possibility it could support life
RCMP to give update on search for missing Alberta boy
RCMP to give update on search for missing Alberta boy

description: Quebec MNA Christopher Skeete, who represents a riding in Laval, said in a post on X that he had learned of a shooting at a Starbucks.
title: Laval, Que., police respond after report of shooting at Starbucks

description: The Sora app's official launch video features an AI-generated version of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman speaking from a psychedelic forest, the moon and a stadium crowded with cheering fans watching rubber duck races.
title: OpenAI launches Sora social media app for AI-generated videos, raising 'AI slop' and copyright worries

description: The federal department of fisheries and oceans has denied permit requests from Marineland Canada to export its 30 beluga whales. Chimelong Ocean Kingdom in China has been considering buying the whales for its ocean theme park.
title: Federal government denies Marineland request to export belugas

description: Part of a highrise apartment building in New York City collapsed Wednesday morning, leaving a corner of the building in a pile of rubble.
title: Part of a highrise apartment building in New York City collapses after gas explosion

description: The alert says residents are asked to leave immediately and register at the reception centre at the Louis Millett Centre in New Minas.
title: More homes evacuated as wildfire burns in N.S.'s Kings County

description: B.C. union leader Rob Ashton entered the NDP leadership race on Wednesday, promoting himself as a contender who understands the concerns of workers.
title: B.C. union leader becomes latest candidate in federal NDP leadership race

description: The Taliban government on Wednesday rejected reports of a nationwide internet ban in Afghanistan, saying old fibre optic cables are worn out and are being replaced.
title: Taliban government rejects reports of nationwide internet ban in Afghanistan

description: Five provinces are increasing their minimum wage today to support workers amid affordability issues, including Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island.
title: 5 Canadian provinces raise their minimum wage; Alberta now lowest in the country

description: The Trump administration violated the U.S. Constitution when it targeted non-citizens for deportation solely for supporting Palestinians and criticizing Israel, a federal judge said Tuesday in a scathing ruling that argued President Donald Trump and his policies are serious threats to free speech.
title: Judge issues scathing ruling over U.S. government attempts to deport residents with pro-Palestinian views

description: On the heels of Canada's recognition of Palestinian statehood, we trace the promise, failure, and uncertain fu
title: Will recognition lead to a Palestinian state?

description: The fitness equipment company Peloton is proposing something different: an artificial intelligence-powered camera that detects your movements and gives you real-time feedback while you workout.
title: Can AI stand in as a personal trainer? Fitness company Peloton thinks so

description: The Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation says there’s about 2,500 condos sitting unsold and empty in Metro Vancouver. The local real estate industry is concerned about layoffs and hopes for housing policy changes.
title: Vancouver's real estate industry concerned about thousands of unsold condos sitting empty

description: Indonesian rescue workers were racing against the clock on Wednesday in the search for survivors from a school collapse in the province of East Java, with at least 91 students still unaccounted for, along with three confirmed dead and about 100 injured.
title: 'Racing against time': Indonesian rescue workers search for dozens in rubble of collapsed school

description: Gerald Siemens wanted to do something special as his 70th birthday approached, and splashed upon a novel idea — jumping in 70 lakes. Siemens travelled all summer with his son, Matthew, who runs SaskLakes.ca, an online directory for all things about the province's more than 100,000 lakes.
title: Sask. man takes the plunge in 70 lakes to celebrate 70th birthday

description: A construction company in Dartmouth is desperate to find help for three employees from the Philippines who may have to leave Canada because of a mistake in their applications to renew work permits with Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada.
title: Facing no income for 6 months, these construction workers might have to abandon their Canadian dreams

description: In the summer of 2022, Higgs, New Brunswick’s Progressive Conservative premier, made sweeping changes to the senior management of the province’s health care system, vowing to find new ways to improve access.
title: 'Fragmenting care': How a pilot project in N.B. pharmacies fell apart

description: Tony Blair, who resigned a U.K. prime minister 18 years ago, appears to think he has one more big political assignment left in him — bringing peace and reconstruction to Gaza. Some Palestinians will need convincing that he’s the man for the job.
title: Both reviled and admired, former U.K. PM Tony Blair is poised to play a key role in Gaza

description: Some taxpayers who filed "bare trust" forms to the Canada Revenue Agency last year may have done so needlessly as the federal government examines further changes to the reporting requirements — changes that could risk creating another chaotic tax season, one accountant warns.
title: Canadians may have needlessly filed bare trust tax forms as feds propose exemptions

description: The AI character and the company behind it have been criticized by high-profile actors, the union that represents them and social media users, following news that talent agents were interested in signing the digital creation.
title: Meet Tilly Norwood, the AI 'actress' prompting backlash from real Hollywood stars

description: CBC News talked to Gazans about their views on the recent 20-point ceasefire proposal. After two years of war, they say they want an end to the conflict and a change in government, but they have concerns about how the plan will be implemented and if it will benefit Palestinians at all.
title: What Palestinians think of Trump's proposed ceasefire plan
